p: We used field populations of two WNV vectors, Cx. pipiens and Cx. restuans, to examine the ovicidal potential of F. asafoetida and A. sativum (garlic) essential oils as well as their individual and combined toxicity against larvae of the two mosquito species. We also characterized the chemical composition of the two essential oils and examined the ovicidal and larvicidal activity of ally disulfide, one of the major and minor components of garlic and asafoetida essential oils, respectively. Both essential oils were quite effective at suppressing egg hatch and killing the larvae, demonstrating their potential application as mosquito ovicides and larvicides. Although garlic extracts and/or essential oil have been shown to possess ovicidal and larvicidal activities against a wide range of insects including mosquitoes ( Park and Shin 2005, Kimbaris et al. 2009, Zhao et al. 2013, Sangha et al. 2017), this is the first report of the biological activity of asafoetida and a mixture of the two essential oils against mosquitoes.
